newsitem.title: USA: Russia's entry into WTO top U.S. priority - Daley.
newsitem.headline: Russia's entry into WTO top U.S. priority - Daley.

text.p: U.S. Commerce Secretary William Daley said Tuesday the United States gave a high priority to Russia's efforts to enter the World Trade Organization.
"Russia's accession to World Trade Organization is a top priority," Daley told the U.S.-Russia Business Council.
Deputy U.S. Trade Representative Jeffrey Lang told the group that Russia's entry into the global trading system would boost investor confidence in the formerly communist country.

"We think from the U.S. point of view, once we have these common rules in effect, confidence in trade with Russia can greatly increase and it will serve as a floor for the internal market reform that is now going forward in Russia," Lang said.

He said U.S. President Bill Clinton and Russian President Boris Yeltsin agreed at their meeting in Helsinki, Finland, last month to set a target of 1998 to get Russia into WTO on commercial terms commonly applicable to acceding countries.

"They want to assure that all WTO membership requirements are met in this Russian accession and that in order for Russia to set an example for others acceding to the WTO it has to adhere to high standards," Lang said. "This is in Russia's interests as well as the interests of the United States and the trading system as a whole."
